attributes.action: Tax on Premier League transfers to install and maintain free to use 4G pitches.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on all Premier league transfers to raise funds to install and maintain 4G pitches in as many towns in England/Wales as possible that are free for kids/sports clubs/schools etc to use. Many children throughout England and Wales have to play football on inadequate pitches.
attributes.additional_details: Many football pitches are (water logged/on a hill/dangerous/ridden with dog muck) despite there being record breaking amounts of money in the English Premier league. £1.165bn spent to date this season already. Health of kids would increase from these pitches as would anti-social behaviour in communities. National football team would benefit as more children given opportunity to play on 'fit for purpose' pitches and fulfill their potential.

attributes.action: Review cases of women needing breast reduction on medical grounds, not cosmetic
attributes.background:
Many women are being refused breast reduction on NHS because it is primarily seen as cosmetic. Funding has been withdrawn in many areas of the UK. 
Many of these women are suffering long term health problems and being denied treatment that would lead to a better quality of life
attributes.additional_details:
Cosmetic surgery is performed to enhance the patients appearance and this type of surgery obviously has its place. 
However, many women are being refused breast reduction on the basis that it is, primarily, acknowledged as a cosmetic procedure. 
Women are suffering chronic backache, which at times can prove crippling, neck pain, shoulder pain, headaches and breast abscesses, to name but a few ailments. 
Referrals to a surgeon are difficult, if not impossible in some areas, due to lack of funding

attributes.action: To cease Brexit negotiations until there is a drop in racially motivated crimes.
attributes.background: Racially motivated crimes appear to have increased in this country. The Government need to halt all Brexit negotiations until there is a substantial drop in racial and xenophobic hate crimes and issue an immediate statement of 'zero tolerance'

attributes.action: Companies get tax benefits to sell recycled tech or parts rather than new tech
attributes.background: Every year, millions of tons of operational tech is thrown away. For example in Europe, the average phone is used for 1.5yrs before being swapped, but most actually last ~6yrs. If the tax system were changed, companies would be encouraged to promote reuse or recycling of old technology.
attributes.additional_details:
See
http://www.electronicstakeback.com/wp-content/uploads/Facts-and-Figures-on-E-Waste-and-Recycling.pdf

attributes.action: Give England its own National Anthem
attributes.background:
Wales, Scotland, and Ireland have their own National Anthems.  In fact, all our neighbours do, but not us, not England.  
During England's football match, the Welsh were able to sing their proud and stirring Welsh National Anthem, but they also sang ours, because it belongs to the UK, not England.
attributes.additional_details:
A National Anthem is about identity, which is particularly important during major sporting fixtures, as well as any public fixtures and competitions between the countries of the United Kingdom.

England is too often left behind, and it is surely time, that in common with her neighbours, she has a National Anthem which is her own.  I want to petition Parliament to consider my proposal, and I suggest 'Land of Hope and Glory' as something everyone can get behind.

Please consider supporting this.

attributes.action: PM table economic review & articulate parameters Brexit not in National Interest
attributes.background:
For strong leadership in this time of uncertainty, UK citizens demand Prime Minister to immediately table an economic review of unintended consequences of vote to leave EU

It is in national interest for PM to articulate economic parameters of unemployment & growth where Brexit will not be Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
Mark Carney Governor Bank of England has articulated likelihood of lower economic growth due to Brexit

Forecast group EY Item Club says business investment & consumer spending will be held back because of uncertainty

Low-cost travel group has gone into administration as direct result of Brexit. How many more organisations will be impacted directly by Brexit cost of jobs & growth?

Lower future economic growth will impact government tax revenues & therefore forecasts of government debt

attributes.action: Organise a Great Exhibition
attributes.background: Trade Delegations from all over the World coming to see what Britain has to offer in all its diversity. Every aspect of Britain and British Life can be represented, and as well as the trade Deals we can make, think of the tremendous impact on Tourism from people coming from all over the World.
attributes.additional_details:
Those Britons who worked so hard on our behalf for the Olympics as Ambassadors can welcome overseas visitors, show people around and generally be involved. 
British Royalty is revered and respected all over the World, and they can take part as did Prince Albert for the 1851 Exhibition.
We can find a way for every person in the UK to have a personal investment in this project, engendering a feeling of pride and ownership in Project Great Britain.

attributes.action: Make It A Legal Requirement To Scan All Cats For A Microchip
attributes.background: My Portia went missing 9 weeks ago and no one has handed her in. Someone must have taken her, thinking she was a stray. Maybe they don't know she's missing, but this is why I want this law in place. I am heartbroken and so are other owners who are missing their cats.
attributes.additional_details: Many cats are taken in, believed to be strays and are never taken to the vets to see if the animal has an owner first.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election at the start of 2017 with proportional representation.
attributes.background: This is a vote of no confidence in the current British Government in light of the EU Refurendum and is a call by the people to form a completely new government. With our prime minister stepping down and calling for new leadership we feel that this should be decided by all the people not by the few.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a significant proportion of people who are upset with the outcome of the referendum and over 2 million are petitioning for another. 

There is a strong majority that feel that their opinions, ideologies and voices are not heard due to our current first past post political popularity contest. 

With a 72% vote on the referendum, people are more politically minded than ever and we should utilise this opportunity to elect a government of the people proportionally elected by the people.

attributes.action: Create an offence of making knowingly or recklessly false claims in elections
attributes.background: The EU Referendum on the continuing membership of the EU has highlighted the use of clear untruths and other misleading comments.  Voters have suggested they would have voted differently if they had known the truth.  There should be criminal liability for such activity to prevent it reoccurring.
attributes.additional_details:
The Leave campaign claimed that £350M per week would be released to be spent on the NHS.  This claim was stated to be false by "Leave" within days of the vote.

Individuals who make false statements to the state (for example in relation to benefits) risk being prosecuted, whilst politicians are not censured for false statements to the people.  We believe that a separate offence of knowingly or recklessly making false statements or misleading the public in relation to elections is required.

attributes.action: RAISE Tariffs on IMPORTED steel to keep British Steel ALIVE.
attributes.background: Our manufacturing sector has been decimated over decades of neglect and a sense of simply not caring. A strong manufacturing sector constitutes a resilient, strong, diverse and booming economy. WE NEED MORE THAN JUST SERVICES. We can begin by raising tariffs on imported, cheap steel.
attributes.additional_details: Our Steel Industry has been decimated over the years by cheap Chinese and other low labour cost nation imports. LEVY IT. This will promote projects within the UK to use British Steel thus reviving the industry, producing jobs and a renewed sense of pride within ourselves. Moreover, to support and kick start this I want capital, state projects to ONLY use British Steel. Beginning with HS2 and other ongoing projects. I believe this will boost economic output and GDP and benefit us all immensely.

attributes.action: Any new Prime Minister must have the confidence of the people and Parliament
attributes.background: We call for the Fixed-term Parliaments Act to be amended such that any new Prime Minister’s government must face an explicit vote of confidence in the Commons. If no government can win such a vote, a general election must be held.
attributes.additional_details:
After the EU Referendum result and the Prime Minister’s resignation, Parliament must show confidence in the Government or call a general election.

 The Government and any new Prime Minister have no mandate for post-referendum negotiations. The exceptional circumstances and political division require a new mandate.

 Petitions cannot call for a vote of No Confidence, nor for the dissolution of Parliament, but they can ask for an amendment to legislation such as the Fixed-term Parliaments Act.

attributes.action:
Non Negotiable for BREXIT
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No Benefits.
attributes.background: Our local communities are getting destroyed by these mass unskilled EU immigration which is putting pressure on schools, NHS. housing, work and more important our quality of life. We want immigration which we need to progress in the world. We cant open borders for abuse by EU migrants for benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The country has voted to LEAVE the EU due to David Cameron's failure and promise to renegotiate with the EU and all the key basic requirements been watered down.

We now want the any future UK Govt to respect and honour the wishes of British people to renegotiate with the EU on the basis of referendum with (Non Negotiable for BREXIT)
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No access to any benefits.

We dont want future UK Govt to water down these main issues for other concessions from the EU.

attributes.action: Keep the United Kingdom inside the European Economic Area (EEA) and rejoin EFTA.
attributes.background:
-A supermajority of young people voted to remain inside the European Union
-We now know the consequences truly of voting to leave and Article 50 hasn't yet been triggered.
-Hundreds of thousands if not millions of Leave voters regret their decision
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned pledge our support for the United Kingdom remaining a part of the EEA, which includes the EU alongside Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway. We pledge our support for rejoining the European Free Trade Agreement, which we established in 1960 and led until 1973. EEA member countries outside the EU participate in its single market but can also negotiate trade agreements freely and independently. We the British people would also continue to have de facto European Union citizenship.

attributes.action: Ensure all future national referendums need more than 50% of electorate to pass
attributes.background: 37% of the electorate took the decision for UK to leave the EU. I believe this to be anti-democratic.
attributes.additional_details:
A minority of the electorate should not be able to take the country in a new direction. 

If an issue is so important it requires a national  referendum,  then to change the status quo it should be able to get more than 50% of the entire electorate,  regardless of turnout. If it cannot get 50% of the entire electorate it should be deemed to have failed.

attributes.action: Give the right to vote to EU citizens having lived in the UK for 5 years or more
attributes.background: EU residents, who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more, have the right to get UK citizenship. However many people do not exercise this option for various reasons and, consequently, they do not have the right to vote. Brexit referendum has shown risks deriving from the lack of this voting right
attributes.additional_details: EU residents are net contributors to the UK economy and represent a crucial asset for the sustainable development of this country. Giving voting rights to EU residents who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more would mean the recognition of a fair right and would allow EU residents to have their say on topics that have a direct impact on their lives (such as the recent EU referendum)

attributes.action: Prevent this divided UK referendum catastrophe from ever happening again.
attributes.background:
No matter which way we voted in the Brexit referendum, we all woke up to a UK where massive economic, political, and social changes in our collective futures were enacted by 51.9% of the voting public and 50% of nation's in the UK. 

Please reform how we do this to avoid it ever happening again.
attributes.additional_details:
We now must deal with the uncertainty wrought by a narrow victory and the division created by having two nations impose their will on two others. 

Once this Europe mess is sorted, we propose the next referendum subject be answered in less divisive manner:

First it must be passed by both Houses of Parliament, that's what they're for.

Then it must gain a majority of voters, which must also total at least 50% of all registered voters.

It must also get a majority in each of our four nations.

attributes.action: Give weapons to Ukraine to defend herself from Russian hybrid war
attributes.background: The level of Russian aggression is rising just as our once formidable ability (back in the cold war ) to counter them seems to have vanished altogether. Instead, we have trouble simply recognizing them for what they are.
attributes.additional_details: Ukraine gave up its nuclear weapons in exchange for the grantee from the United Kingdom that they will protect the Ukrainian nation from invasion. The Budapest Memorandum on Security Assurances signed in Budapest, Hungary on 5 December 1994, providing security assurances by its signatories relating to Ukraine's accession to the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons. The Memorandum was signed by USA and the United Kingdom..  It is time to honor the spirit of the agreement..

attributes.action: Grant all those who have finished Secondary education the ability to vote.
attributes.background: By the end of secondary education, people have to decide where next to go in there life, whether it be further education, an apprenticeship or full time employment. At this age, people make life changing decisions about there own life. Why shouldn't they have a say in there country's life?
attributes.additional_details:
Year groups at college are split, as some people are too young to vote. Some people who are slightly too young to vote have to deal with other people's decisions until they are, in some cases, 22 years old. 
Some people can go through life with just there secondary education, and still have the ability to vote. So it cannot be argued that, in this case, with only a secondary education, teenagers do not have the mental capability to vote. 
We should allow young people to shape there future.

attributes.action: Allow immigrants to vote in UK national elections and referendums.
attributes.background: The scapegoating of immigrants during political campaigns narrows the debate, hides the true reasons for economic problems, and distorts the result. If immigrants were granted the vote, as they are in local elections, they would not be targeted in this way.
attributes.additional_details: During the 18 September 2014 referendum on Scottish independence, all EU and Commonwealth citizens resident in Scotland aged 16 or over could vote. During the 23rd June 2016 referendum on the UK's membership of the EU, immigrants from the EU were not allowed to vote, though commonwealth citizens were. The campaign focussed unduly on the issue of immigration to the detriment of other important issues.

attributes.action: Introduce a direct democracy which gives power back to citizens
attributes.background: Direct democracy allows any citizen to challenge any law approved by the parliament or, at any time, propose a modification of the federal Constitution. Switzerlands direct democracy holds referendums to decide on new and current legislation. Its time to bring democracy back to the UK.

attributes.action: Make the UK main summer test cricket series, a free to air television event.
attributes.background: This petition is for a ruling, that the main test cricket series of the summer in England or Wales be shown on free to air television. As are The FA Cup, The Six Nations and The Grand National; with a protected, permanent free to air broadcasting status.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition strongly believes that in order to develop the next generation of cricket stars, youngsters need to be able to easily and readily see cricketing heroes, performing at the highest cricket level. It is one of our national sports and the entire nation should be able to watch the main summer test match series.

This is one test series a year on free to air television. So this petition feels that this is a fair demand.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for an employer to impose gender specific dress codes on staff.
attributes.background: Many companies have dress codes, or uniform guidelines, which their employees must follow. Many elements are based on gender stereotypes, and it is common practise to have different standards for male and female. Elements may include; headwear, shoes, skirts/trousers, make-up and hair styles.
attributes.additional_details: Most companies in the service and corporate sector have strict uniform guidelines that include elements like; Women must wear skirts, men must wear trousers. Women must wear make-up, men must not wear make-up. Women are allowed long hair styles, men are allowed only short hair styles. If an employee does not comply with the uniform guidelines, as per their predefined gender, the employee will be subject to disciplinary procedure which may include dismissal. The aim with this petition is to make it a legal requirement for the employer to remove all gender references in regards to company dress and grooming standards, and that any imposed standard may be followed by any employee regardless of the employees’ gender association.

attributes.action: Invest in cleaning up and preventing the pollution in the River Thames
attributes.background: The Thames is an integral natural landmark in London, one of the best there are in the UK. Pollution in recent years has been a rising problem across the world, but in this river alone thousands of animals have died or been poisoned, and the water resource is unused by the public entirely.

attributes.action: Stop the force of adoption from innocent young mums!
attributes.background: I fell in love at a young age like most of us do, it was a confusing time but I though that was it life was perfect, so when I fell pregnant and then found out it was twins! I had my family for life but then because of my age social workers started sniffing around.
attributes.additional_details: I had a good childhood, just my mum and siblings but we had it good  (not having a father around made my decision to keep my babies easier!) I had never even heard of social services until I got pregnant. I got allocated a family nurse  (who befriended me,secretly was against my pregnancy) from there the child snatching plan begun, me and my partner went into a unit together to bring up our children independently , they let me dote over them for a year while secretly finding them a new mum.

attributes.action: Stop schools from giving awards for 100% attendance.
attributes.background: Schools often issue awards for children who attain 100% attendance. Apart from the fact that this discriminates against many children who have medical appointments which cannot be arranged out of term time, absence from school for certain illnesses is required, making 100% attendance impossible.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the childhood illnesses children contract are caught from their classmates, at school. Many of these illnesses, such as chicken pox, rotavirus and impetigo, require children to be absent from school for a minimum period of time before returning. This means the 100% attendance award is an impossibility and awarding it to children who have somehow managed not to suffer from these illnesses throughout the school year makes other children feel inadequate. It's discriminatory and must stop.

attributes.action: Establish Hallowe'en  (31st October) as an annual national statutory holiday.
attributes.background: Hallowe'en has grown in popularity in the UK as a non-religious, community event.  This celebration encourages creativity as children make costumes & characters. Trick-or-treating encourages people to get out into their neighbourhoods and enjoy a home-made, creative festival together.
attributes.additional_details:
There are no other autumn holidays in the UK and would occur at a midpoint between the August Bank Holiday and Christmas. 
2. The historic origins of Hallowe'en are outlined on the Historic UK: http://www.historic-uk.com/CultureUK/Halloween/
3. This link which outlines some risks and debunks some unfounded fears. http://content.time.com/time/nation/article/0,8599,1933329,00.html .  This holiday could promote safe driving to enable children be safe outside at all times of year.

attributes.action: Move the Houses of Parliament to Birmingham.
attributes.background: Houses of Parliament restoration work is estimated to cost £4 billion. We propose a new building on the outskirts of Birmingham near to the Airport and Exhibition Centre. A geographically central home in our second city would be created for Parliament and would provide excellent transport links.

attributes.action: Review decision-making process behind closure of nightclubs in the UK.
attributes.background: Following Islington Council's decision last night (6th September) not to renew the license for Fabric, an iconic dance music venue in London, we request that parliament reviews why decisions like this one and others are consistently being made to the detriment of dance and youth music culture.
attributes.additional_details: Fabric holds global significance for dance music, launching the careers of many artists and drawing crowds from all over world. In the last three months several other venues including The Arches, Passing Clouds and Dance Tunnel have also been forced to close. Dance music is an important part of music culture; the closure of places that grow the community, foster innovation and provide a venue to enjoy this music, will lead to the loss of the UK’s status of a breeding ground for musical talent.

attributes.action: Make June 23 a bank holiday to celebrate UK Independence Day.
attributes.background: To celebrate the EU referendum historic result where the people of the UK voted to regain independence from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The people have spoken and voted for a self Governing UK. This wonderful example of democratic success deserves to be remembered forever. A bank holiday would enable the people to celebrate the occasion.

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: In 2012 the Coalition Government raised tuition fees to £9000 a year, which means students now face crippling debt. This shackling debt often lasts decades. Free education is a right not a privilege. We have to act now to take back what's rightfully ours!
attributes.additional_details: Young students eager to better themselves as people are facing crippling debt after they leave university unless they are born of a very wealthy family. This ensures that the wealth stays with the families who have always had it. Worse still is the number of young people denied the chance of university due to their disadvantaged background. Free education is vital if we are to have a country that utilises the most talented rather than the most fortunate. Free education is necessary for equality.

attributes.action: Do not allow MP's  to veto the democratic vote  to leave the European Union.
attributes.background: The people of the U.K. By a majority voted to leave the European Union on June 23rd 2016 but some MP's believe that it is their right to ignore the electorate who made this decision. Therefore we the undersigned call on the government not allow a vote on this decision.
attributes.additional_details: In refusing the opportunity for MP's to be given this vote it must remembered that Government gave a commitment to referendum which it stood by and the electorate with a turnout of more than 70% voted to leave the EU. Therefore Brexit must mean Brexit.

attributes.action: Incentivise broadband providers, only pay for the broad band you get
attributes.background: Provider use the phrase ‘up to’ so there is no incentive for them to improve the speed or systems to provide what you are paying for.  e.g  speed quoted at 20 Mbs and you get 10 Mbs then you would only pay half the cost and so on. Providers would then need to tell the truth on broad band speeds.

attributes.action: Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.background:
This year marks 34 years since the Falklands War. 
The invasion of the Falkland Islands occurred April 2 1982. 
The conflict ended June 14 1982. 
We believe that to mark our Armed Forces bravery and sacrifice, this date should be known as Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the Government should mark the liberation of the Falkland Islands and name June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.
To mark our brave Armed Forces' bravery, courage and sacrifice, we believe  this should be officially recognised.
The Falklands Islands mark Margaret Thatcher Day every year. They have the right to self determination.
It is now time to mark this in our own calendar.
Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.

attributes.action: Support Peoples QE. Reduce private debts, boost savings, rescue the economy.
attributes.background: Public and Private Debts are at an all time high in the United Kingdom.  net unsecured borrowing on credit cards and loans will rise to £662bn by the end of the decade, from £447bn in 2016. The amount of private debt is crippling the economy. We need to reduce debt in the economy.
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing that we reduce private debt through Bond given to all UK Citizens. The bond would be financed throuh QE  money created by the Bank of England. This financial value of the bond ( sat £1000 per person) would be used to either clear existing debts ( as specified) or as a savings bond for people without debt. The policy would reduce debt, increase savings, compensate savers for low interest rates reduce poverty, and help the economy to grow.

attributes.action: GAIN 'CONSUMER RIGHTS' REGARDING 'OVER PHONE' CONTRACTS FOR SMALL BUSINESSES.
attributes.background: l purchased a small pub 2 years ago to save from closure. When agreeing a Sports package over the phone I realised the next day this was not what I required. After immediate calls, letter and emails I was told I have no 14 day cooling off period, I could not cancel, and had to pay for a full year.
attributes.additional_details: Small businesses do not have the infrastructure of large companies and cannot have resources to cover all areas for contracts, accountancy, and legal complications. Specifically regarding contracts agreed over the phone where the seller could not possibly deliver all the rules and regulations of a contract, there should be 14 days allowed to consider an agreement in full. Presently an 'over the phone agreement' is irreversible and binding. Equivalence of consumer rights for Small Businesses.

attributes.action: Improve CAMHS services in Cumbria, especially surrounding eating disorders.
attributes.background: There is a huge lack of resources and staff within Cumbria CAMHS, having just one dietitician in the entire county. The team regularly allows patients suffering from eating disorders to get so severe they require inpatient treatment hundreds of miles away.There are no specialists and a lack of care.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS stands for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, and this is where children and teenagers up to the age of 18 get support and therapy for their mental illnesses. 
There are NO specialist eating disorder services within the whole county; the closest being Middlesborough, which I am currently staying as an inpatient with severe Anorexia Nervosa for the second time due to the immense lack of support and understanding in Cumbria. This is a 2 and a half hour journey. 
This is not fair.

attributes.action: Make Counselling and Psychotherapy a professional qualification.
attributes.background:
Anyone is able to set up in private practice and call themselves a Counsellor or Psychotherapist.
I would like a minimum qualification that is recognised by a regulatory body, such as the BACP, to benchmark a qualification to prevent poorly trained or unqualified individuals from practising.

attributes.action: Make horse riders pick up their horses excrement! Or slap them with a fine!
attributes.background: Why should horse riders get away with leaving massive piles of dump in the middle of the road and down our streets, when dog owners get slapped with a massive fine for a little dump! All pets should be treated with the same rules! No excuses!

attributes.action: Introduce a jury system so family's fighting forced adoption have a fair trial
attributes.background: Fighting social services on forced adoption, give families a fair say and the options to explore every solution on earth to make changes to keep families together.
attributes.additional_details: Adoption is so final and social services play God with children's lives forced adoption is barbaric

attributes.action: Introduce a radical overhaul of British football’s development of youth talent.
attributes.background: We call on Tracey Crouch MP (minister of Sport) and the government, to implement a German-style ‘Extended Talent Promotion Programme’ within British football. We need a similar radical overhaul of how we coach youth football, how we structure our youth development, and how we nurture young talent.

attributes.action: To revoke the Barnett Formula for Scotland
attributes.background: Scotland has an unfair advantage due to the excessive money given to Scotland by the Barnett Formula. They use this to spend in uncontrolled ways, i.e. Free prescriptions and tuition fees.  This is grossly unfair to the people of England and should be stopped with immediate effect.

attributes.action: Referendums must garner over 50% in all four nations of the UK to be passed
attributes.background: Referendums risk the break-up of the United Kingdom, if the four nations vote in different ways, as devolved parliaments can cite "material changes" that allow a referendum of independence in their respective nations to be carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kngdom is a valued but vulnerable Union. The U.K. Parliament must respect the views of the constituent nations when consulting the public over constitutional matters. Therefore, referendums must require the support of each constituent nation (England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland). 

The undersigned wish this to be enforced retrospectively, including the recent EU referendum.

attributes.action: For Armed Forces Veterans become Priority to housing, benefits and hospitals
attributes.background: For Government to acknowledge the fact that they have Veterans who are homeless and have mental issues due to their time in the forces and to give them priority

attributes.action: Deploy warships in the English Channel to stop and deter illegal migrants.
attributes.background: Over the past few weeks there have been known several incidents of illegal migrants trying to cross the English Channel to get in the UK. So far only one of the attempted crossings have been successful but it is inevitable that more will get into the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
For too long, the UK has been lenient when it comes to illegals trying to get into our nation and we must set an example to defend ourselves from possible terrorists posing as migrants (as seen during the Cologne and Paris attacks). And also to prevent further actual refugees from risking their lives trying to get into the UK.

I ask the Government to deploy warships into the English Channel to; stop and turn around illegals, deter further illegals from risking their lives in the effort to get into the UK, and if necessary use lethal force to defend British waters.

attributes.action: That Non Stun slaughter be debated in Parliament.
attributes.background: I have researched what the doctrinal basis for Shechita is. We are in the new millennium and Shechita slaughter is no longer the most humane way to kill. When the Holy Prophet was alive, stunning methods used today did not exist.
attributes.additional_details:
The Food Research Institute state that killing an animal before it is bled out by high voltage electrical stunning does not affect the amount of blood lost from the carcass.  I have spoken to Jewish people on this issue they say they can see no reason why animals cannot be stunned first.
A witness to Shechita slaughter described a knife was drawn 17 times across a bullocks throat. A shock on his face as he tried to move away.

attributes.action: Make History a mandatory Core subject which can't be dropped
attributes.background: History is a subject which has enormous value. It teaches us the successes and errors which have happened in the past so we can learn from. At this current point in time children are not appreciating what their ancestors did for them and how Society has been shaped by historical actions.

attributes.action: Allow retirement with State Pension if people worked 40 years and contributed.
attributes.background: Loads of people have worked all of their lives and never claimed benefits, we now see retirement ages get further away. If they have worked all of their lives and paid taxes and NI  for 40 years  they should be allowed to retire with state pension irrespective of age..

attributes.action: 2 years Jnr armed forces training should count towards your pensionable service.
attributes.background:
I want the uk government to recognize armed forces training as a junior from 16 to 18 should count towards your pensionable service.
Any other industry would recognize your employment at 16 from day one.
This affects your pension as a working serviceman or woman in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I joined the Army as a 16 year old soldier & spent 2 years training.
Then completed 9 years colour service, then 1 year open engagement.
The government only recognise 9 years colour service as this technically the contract i signed. 
In business where service is recognised, where else would you have 3 years not rewarded in any way, especially as those are the years I spent learning my trade.
My pension has been devalued by 3 years because the government will only pay for my contracted period of 9.

attributes.action:
Make it illegal for UK private nurseries to charge parents for 
Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Private nurseries in the UK charge parents for every Bank Holiday in the UK (8 in total) but the nursery remains closed. This can cost parents in excess over £1,000 PER CHILD before a child turns school age. Parents are paying for a service that is not provided and does not exist.
